intro: Draba lactea, commonly known as the milkweed draba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cold, dry conditions. Its flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Draba lactea is also known for its ability to tolerate nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
